RainbruRPG::Terminal::ScrollingPanel

RainbruRPG::Terminal::ScrollingPanel Class Reference

#include <scrollingpanel.h>

Collaboration diagram for RainbruRPG::Terminal::ScrollingPanel:

[legend]
List of all members.

Detailed Description

Provides the scrolling ability of the Window.

The scrolling ability is done by logical and physical dimension. The xOffset and yOffset values is the position of the first visible caract√®er.

The goDown(), goUp(), goRight() and goLeft() functions must be called when the corresponding arrows keys are pressed.

The ability to draw is done by a list of SLangCommand subclasses. eEach slc* is a wrapper to a S-Lang operation.

Constructor & Destructor Documentation

RainbruRPG::Terminal::ScrollingPanel::ScrollingPanel (  ) 

The default constructor.

Sets the logical and physical screen's size to 1,1. The offstes are both set to 0.

Definition at line 189 of file scrollingpanel.cpp.

void RainbruRPG::Terminal::ScrollingPanel::goDown (  ) 

Set the yOffset as if we move the physical screen down.

The limit is tested as yOffset<=(logicalHeight-physicalHeight)

Definition at line 78 of file scrollingpanel.cpp.

void RainbruRPG::Terminal::ScrollingPanel::goUp (  ) 

Set the yOffset as if we move the physical screen up.

The limit is tested as yOffset>=0

Definition at line 91 of file scrollingpanel.cpp.

void RainbruRPG::Terminal::ScrollingPanel::goRight (  ) 

Set the xOffset as if we move the physical screen right.

The limit is tested as xOffset<=(logicalWidth-physicalWidth)

Definition at line 102 of file scrollingpanel.cpp.

The limit is tested as xOffset>=0
